newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile concerned by rise in fatal mine accidents.
newsitem.headline: Chile concerned by rise in fatal mine accidents.

text.p: Chilean mining minister Benjamin Teplizky said Wednesday he was concerned by a sharp rise in fatal accidents in the mining industry in the first two months of the year.
Figures from government body Sernageomin showed that 10 miners were killed in accidents in the first two months of this year compared to seven deaths in the same period in 1996.
"The level of accidents is worrying. There is nothing which justifies a death at work," Teplizky told a news conference.
The accidents occurred in large copper and gold mines as well as much smaller pits worked by groups of miners.
Teplizky said 56 people died in mining accidents last year, up from 39 in 1995.
Four men died in an accident last year at the recently completed El Abra copper mine when a tunnel collapsed burying the men under tonnes of debris and rocks.
